hero.title: Grants & Funding
hero.subtitle: Empowering Change
hero.description: Empowering change through strategic funding and support for sustainable community development

overview.title: Available Grants
overview.description: We offer various grant opportunities to support initiatives that align with our mission of empowering women and girls. Our grants are designed to create lasting impact in communities across Africa.

grants.title: Education Empowerment Grant
grants.description: Support for educational initiatives, scholarships, and learning resources.
requirements: Focus on women and girls education

grants.title: Women Entrepreneurs Grant
grants.description: Funding for women-led businesses and entrepreneurial ventures.

grants.title: Healthcare Access Grant
grants.description: Support for healthcare initiatives and medical services.
requirements: Focus on women and children health

steps.title: Review Guidelines
steps.description: Read through grant requirements and eligibility criteria

steps.title: Prepare Documents
steps.description: Gather required documentation and project proposal

steps.title: Submit Application
steps.description: Complete and submit your application online

steps.title: Review Process
steps.description: Applications reviewed by our expert panel

faqs.question: Who can apply for grants?
faqs.answer: Our grants are open to registered non-profits, educational institutions, and women-led businesses that align with our mission and meet the specific grant requirements.

faqs.question: What is the selection process?
faqs.answer: Applications are reviewed by our expert panel based on impact potential, sustainability, and alignment with our mission. The process typically takes 4-6 weeks.

faqs.question: Can I apply for multiple grants?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can apply for multiple grants if your organization meets the eligibility criteria for each grant category.

faqs.question: How are funds disbursed?
faqs.answer: Funds are disbursed in phases based on project milestones and reporting requirements outlined in the grant agreement.
